Elyas.view

Class DrawController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Elyas.view.DrawController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class DrawController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Author:
    Elyas Syoufi

    This class is responsible for keeping track of the sensors. it randomizes and places the sensors as needed. it has the ability to animate sensors as well as pure controller without GUI updates

                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • setDrawableArea

        public void setDrawableArea()
        initializes the draw area. must be called before manipulating the sensors.

      • setRange

        public void setRange(float from,
                     float to)
        sets the range that the sensors should be in
        Parameters:
        from - the start of the range
        to - the end of the range

      • setNumberOfSensors

        public void setNumberOfSensors(int n,
                               boolean redraw)
        sets the number of sensors. sensors are automatically randomized when this function is called
        Parameters:
        n - the new number of sensors
        redraw - whether to update the GUI or not. should be true if the client has enabled animation.

      • updateDrawing

        public void updateDrawing()
        updates the GUI to represent the current status of the sensors.

      • setSensorRadius

        public void setSensorRadius(float i,
                            boolean redraw)
        sets the radius of the sensors
        Parameters:
        i - the radius to set
        redraw - whether or not to update the GUI

      • getSensors

        public java.util.Collection<Sensor> getSensors()

      • moveSensor

        public void moveSensor(Sensor sensor,
                       java.lang.Double speed)
        moves the GUI node associated with this sensor to the sensor's location.
        Parameters:
        sensor - the sensor that the node is associated with
        speed - the animation speed to move the sensor
        See Also:
        moveSensors(List, Double, boolean, EventHandler)

      • moveSensors

        public void moveSensors(java.util.List<Sensor> toMove,
                        java.lang.Double speed,
                        boolean oneAtATime,
                        javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> onFinish)
        moves the GUI nodes associated with the given sensors.
        Parameters:
        toMove - the sensors with the new positions
        speed - the animation speed
        oneAtATime - true if the sensors should wait for the last sensor to finish moving before the next one starts. false if they should all move at the same time.
        onFinish - called when all the sensors have finished moving.

      • randomizeSensors

        public void randomizeSensors(boolean redraw)
        creates random positions for the current sensors.
        Parameters:
        redraw - whether or not to update the GUI

      • getSensorRadius

        public float getSensorRadius()

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(java.lang.Boolean n)
        sets the drawing pane visibility to 'n'.
        Parameters:
        n - true if the drawing should be visible. false otherwise
